item.title: Figure’s IPO filing marks Mike Cagney’s return to public markets
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Figure Technology, a seven-year-old blockchain-based lending company, has filed a registration statement with the SEC for an IPO of its Class A common stock. The filing offers a chance at vindication for Figure co-founder Mike Cagney.

item.title: AI crawler Firecrawl raises $14.5M, is still looking to hire agents as employees
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Firecrawl nabbed Shopify’s CEO Tobias Lütke as an investor from a gutsy email after they discovered he was using the product.

item.title: Spotify’s latest feature lets you add your own transitions to playlists
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The new options are designed to appeal to playlist experts and other music fans, who have collectively created nearly 9 billion playlists on Spotify's platform to date.

item.title: Eight Sleep raises $100M to expand its AI-powered sleep tech
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: The sleep tech company raised from HSG, Valor Equity Partners, Founders Fund, Y Combinator and big F1 names like Charles Leclerc and Zak Brown.

item.title: OpenAI launches a sub-$5 ChatGPT plan in India
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: This plan will offer 10x more messages and image generation than the free tier, among other benefits.

item.title: SoftBank makes $2B investment in Intel
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: SoftBank will pay $23 per share for Intel common stock.

item.title: Allianz Life data breach affects 1.1 million customers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Data breach notification site Have I Been Pwned notified 1.1 million customers of a July data breach, a number not previously reported.

item.title: X’s declining Android app installs are hurting subscription revenue
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: X is struggling on Android with installs down by 49% year-over-year as of June 2025.

item.title: Texas attorney general accuses Meta, Character.AI of misleading kids with mental health claims
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Texas attorney general Ken Paxton is investigating Meta and CharacterAI over claims they deceptively market chatbots as mental health tools, raising concerns about child safety, data privacy, and targeted advertising.

item.title: Hank Green’s Focus Friend app is climbing the App Store charts — and it’s extremely cute
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: If you fail to stay focused, you will make an anthropomorphic bean very sad, because its knitting project depends on your ability to stay on task.

item.title: Substack writers can now direct US readers to (often cheaper) web-based subscriptions on iOS
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Substack's iOS app rolls out support for web-based payments, which can save subscribers money.

item.title: Pixel 10, AI capabilities, and everything else we expect out of the Made by Google 2025 event
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Dive into what we can expect from the Made by Google 2025 event, where the tech giant will debut its Pixel 10 lineup.

item.title: The wait is almost over: The 2025 Startup Battlefield 200 list drops August 27
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: After reviewing thousands of groundbreaking applications from around the globe, we're just days away from announcing the 2025 Startup Battlefield 200.

item.title: Made by Google 2025: How to watch Google debut the Pixel 10, Pixel Watch 4, and more
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Google is hosting its Pixel 10 event next week. Learn how to watch the tech giant reveal its new mobile devices and what else you can expect.

item.title: iPhone 17, the ‘thinnest iPhone ever,’ and everything else we’re expecting out of Apple’s hardware event
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From a new slim iPhone Air model to redesigned AirPods, here's what to expect from this year's Apple event.

item.title: ‘Crazy conspiracist’ and ‘unhinged comedian’: Grok’s AI persona prompts exposed
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The website for xAI's Grok chatbot is exposing the system prompts for several of its AI personas, including a “crazy conspiracist” that seems designed to handhold a user into believing that "a secret global cabal" controls the world.

item.title: Why Paradigm built a spreadsheet with an AI agent in every cell
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Paradigm raised a $5 million seed round and is releasing it's AI-powered spreadsheet to the general public.

item.title: Linktree goes dark in India — and the company isn’t sure why
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Linktree is "investigating" an issue that has made its link-in-bio platform inaccessible in India for several days.

item.title: HR giant Workday says hackers stole personal data in recent breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The HR tech giant said it had no indication of any unauthorized access to customer systems, but has not ruled out a breach affecting customers' personal information.

item.title: Perplexity now supports live earnings call transcripts for Indian stocks
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: AI startup Perplexity is augmenting its Finance dashboard with the ability to transcribe Indian public companies' quarterly earnings calls live, as well as show schedules for post-results conference calls.
